content.description: Make a difficult friction move - or just jump - to reach good holds leading up to the crack. Climb the crack to its end and continue on the same line to the left edge of a small overhang. Climb straight up through the left edge to the main ledge.
content.location: Near the center of the Slab, 12' right of the unmistakeable left-facing, left-slanting corner (Scenic Slip), below a large hand-sized crack that slants up left but does not make it to the ground.

content.description: Climb the 10' high slanting crack to its end, then (crux) straight up pure friction slab along the right side of a bump for 15' to the first decent handhold. Continue straight up, past another tricky move to gain low-angle, easier slab climbing to the Viewpoint Ledge.
content.protection: None. TR this line. Use the Birch Tree belay.
content.location: Sixteen feet right of Every Creature's Theme, at a left-rising crack/seam that dies out after ten feet.

content.description: Delicate face moves following parallel seams lead to an overlap 12' up (first pro). More tricky moves lead up the steep face to a good ledge stance. Climb through a small "meadow" of brush to the right side of an overhang. Continue along the overgrown, left-slanting seam line or go straight up on cleaner but unprotected, low-angle slab.
content.protection: Medium cam under the overlap and a small cam under the overhang.
content.location: 5' right of Viewpoint Crack, about 17' right of the obvious left-facing, left-rising corner (Scenic Slip).

content.description: Climb up to the left-slanting, left-facing corner and ascend it to its end. Continue up the seam to a small birch clump, then head straight up on knobby, easy slab to the Viewpoint Ledge.
content.protection: Bring small nuts or slider/ball-nut, 3/4"-1" cams.   There is one bolt near crux.   Belay on Viewpoint Ledge using trees.
content.location: Near center of crag, below an obvious left-facing, left-slanting corner.

content.description: Climb the seam to a flat upward-pointing flake & move left to the left seam. Continue up, following the crack system to the main ledge.
content.protection: Standard modern rack. Sling the flake.
content.location: Right side of the crag's level, low base.

content.description: Ascend short slab to rounded, subtle open book/right-facing corner. Climb up this and make a tenuous reach for the first good handhold above the "book". Climb up and slightly right to the left-rising crack system and either cross this and up on unprotected knobs or follow it to join the upper part of Every Creature's Theme.
content.location: Twenty feet right of Every Creature's Theme, four feet right of the short crack of Slab-Happy, below a ten foot high, rounded, subtle right-facing corner/open book.

content.description: Getting off the ground is the most difficult move: bouldery move to gain positive mantel holds.   The friction climbing above is desperate, unprotected for anyone attempting a lead. After the bouldery start, the route parallels the outside corner of Every Creature's Theme, joining that route at the slab section or optionally heading up and right on dirty, blank slab.
content.protection: Virtually None. Use the tree belay of Every Creature's Theme.
content.location: Ten feet right of Every Creature's Theme, at a bulging wall with small, positive holds just out of reach.

content.description: Climb the left-facing corner to its end, then ascend the slab up and slightly left along open rock, to belay at a birch tree growing beside a spruce tree just upslope of the Viewpoint ledge.
content.protection: G in the corner (cams 1" to 3"), 5.2 R/X to a bolt on the slab above (#1 & 2 Camalots help getting to the bolt).
content.location: Leftmost end of the slab; the obvious left-facing corner. This route is NOT visible when first coming to the bottom of the crag; it is just around a corner.

content.description: The crux is unprotected, but one move after getting off the ground. Work up the face to the "flap" (first pro) and climb past it to a good ledge stance.   One can finish at will, either going straight up unprotected slab, following the crack of Puzzle, or (original method) stepping right across Puzzle to the mostly-unprotected slab climbing that leads to the main ledge.
content.protection: One medium cam; an assortment of cams if one follows the Puzzle crack; a couple larger cams if one climbs right of Puzzle.
content.location: 10' left of the right end of the level bottom of the route, below two blue-black stains on the face above.

content.description: 80' to 130' low-angle face/slab with ~ dozen established routes and variations, ranging from 5.4 to 5.10. Convenient to the hiking trail, easy on/off, easy TR set-up.   The routes here require skilful friction technique, and in most cases are very runout for leading, with the exception of Every Creature's Theme and Puzzle.
